---
title: gensx env ls
description: List all GenSX environments in a project
---

# gensx env ls

The `gensx env ls` command lists all environments in your GenSX project, showing their names and current status.

## Usage

```bash
gensx env ls [options]
```

## Options

| Option                  | Description                                                                  |
| ----------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| `-p, --project <name>`  | Project name to list environments for.                                       |
| `-h, --help`            | Display help for the command.                                                |

## Description

This command:

1. Lists all environments in your specified project
2. Shows which environment is currently selected (if any)
3. Displays environment details in a tabular format

The output includes:
- Environment name
- Creation date
- Whether it's the default environment
- Current selection status

## Examples

```bash
# List all environments in the current project
gensx env ls

# List environments in a specific project
gensx env ls --project my-app
```

## Notes

- You must be logged in to GenSX Cloud to list environments (`gensx login`)
- The command shows environments across all projects if no specific project is specified
- The currently selected environment is marked with an asterisk (*)
- The default environment is marked with (default)
